main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Terre Haute, Indiana on August 18, 1959.
interesting points: The object was observed at a calculated height of 120,000 feet,The object's angular path was approximately 30 degrees and it had a rapid angular velocity,The object was extremely bright but no trail or impact noise was recorded,Observations coincided with the firing of a missile,Investigations suggest the object may have been a bolide or a meteor.
witness description: The witness described the object's shape as shell-like and reported a sound resembling frying.
